title.narrative: Supporting life-saving response activities in complicated SAM in major affected drought municipalities in Angola

description.narrative: This WHO project aims is to decrease the death caseload due to complicated severe acute malnutrition in under-five-year-old children in priority municipalities from six provinces in Central and Southern Angola. The activities are Procurement of kits for treatment for complicated SAM, Refresher training of healthcare workers (professional and health technicians), and Nutritional and Risk communication directed to provide special attention to children of underage single mothers, children of women at risk of gender-based violence. The expected impact is to improve access to adequate WHO-based treatment with trained personnel using the validated kits for this purpose. The Project consider providing treatment to 1790 out of 2,356 complicated SAM and 2,356 mothers in risk of gender-violence (as underage single mothers, without adequate familiar support or any other social disadvantaged situation) of severe complicated children with messages directed to increase the access of their children for attention in Special Nutrition Centers. In total, 4,146 persons will benefit, including 2,356 women,871 girls, and 916 boys. WHO also expects to reach 189 people with disabilities.
